name: Drink the Book: Brandy Sour
description: This sour uses brandy as its base. Though less common than bourbon, it has a similar level of sweetness, thus making it a great foil for lemon juice. A Brandy Sour is similar to a Sidecar but eschews the orange flavor of Cointreau for simple syrup to showcase the flavors of the liquor and lemon.

recipeInstructions.text: Add cognac, lemon and simple syrup to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake well and strain into a sour glass.
Add a single piece of ice and garnish with a lemon round. Serve.
